Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.host.models.openbmc_lightning

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
import re
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.ipmi import IPMI
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.openbmc import OpenBMC
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.sshpass import SSHPassConn
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.credentials import (
    DEFAULT_OPENBMC_USERNAME,
    DEFAULT_OPENBMC_PASSWORD
)



[docs]class OpenBMCLightning(OpenBMC):


[docs]    def __init__(self, host, bmc_host, oob_addr, slot_info=None):
        self.host = host
        if oob_addr:
            self.bmc_host = SSHPassConn(
                host=self.get_usb0_ip(),
                source_host=host.connection,
                user=DEFAULT_OPENBMC_USERNAME,
                password=DEFAULT_OPENBMC_PASSWORD
            )
        else:
            self.bmc_host = bmc_host
        self.oob_addr = oob_addr
        self.ipmi = IPMI(host, bmc_host, oob_addr)
        self.slot_info = self.get_slot_info()



[docs]    def get_slot_info(self):
        return ""



[docs]    def cycle(self, timeout=1200):
        return self.ipmi.cycle(timeout)



[docs]    def is_lightning(self):
        try:
            fru_details = self.get_fruid_info()
            if "Lightning" in fru_details:
                return True
        except Exception:
            pass
        return False



[docs]    def get_critical_services(self):
        '''
        This method returns a list of services that are always expected to
        run on the openBMC lightening System
        '''
        return ['healthd', 'fscd']



[docs]    def get_config_details(
        self,
        log_dir,
        test_start_time,
        start=True,
        bios_dump_filter=None
    ):
        return {}



[docs]    def get_full_sensor_data(self):
        out = self.all_sensor_data()
        out += "\n" + self.peb_sensor_data()
        out += "\n" + self.pdpb_sensor_data()
        out += "\n" + self.fcb_sensor_data()
        return out



[docs]    def peb_sensor_data(self):
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/"
        cmd += "sensor-util peb"

        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def pdpb_sensor_data(self):
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/"
        cmd += "sensor-util pdpb"

        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def fcb_sensor_data(self):
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/"
        cmd += "sensor-util fcb"

        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def ac_cycle(self, timeout=1200, reboot_check=True):
        return self.ipmi.ac_cycle(timeout)



[docs]    def power_reset(self, timeout=1200):
        return self.ipmi.power_reset(timeout)



[docs]    def power_on(self, timeout=1200, last_reboot=None):
        return self.ipmi.power_on(timeout)



[docs]    def power_off(self, timeout=600):
        return self.ipmi.power_off(timeout)



[docs]    def status(self):
        return self.ipmi.status()



[docs]    def validate_fan_speed(self, percentage_actual, percentage_expected):
        # In Lightning, the percentage got will be always -1 to the value
        # of percentage given by user
        if (int(percentage_expected) == percentage_actual + 1):
            AutovalUtils.log_info(
                "Percentage successfully set to desired value"
            )
        else:
            raise TestError("Failed to set fan speed to desired value")
